libshapedraw.primitive

Interface ReadonlyColor

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Color

    public interface ReadonlyColor
extends java.io.Serializable
    Read-only interface for Color objects, allowing for compile-time safety.
    See Also:
    Color

    • Method Detail

      • copy

        Color copy()
        Returns:
        a new deep-copied mutable Color. Does not copy animations.

        Same concept as Object.clone(), minus the tedious/clunky checked exception, CloneNotSupportedException.

      • getRed

        double getRed()
        Returns:
        this color's red component, in the range [0.0, 1.0].

      • getGreen

        double getGreen()
        Returns:
        this color's green component, in the range [0.0, 1.0].

      • getBlue

        double getBlue()
        Returns:
        this color's blue component, in the range [0.0, 1.0].

      • getAlpha

        double getAlpha()
        Returns:
        this color's alpha component, in the range [0.0, 1.0]. 0.0 is fully transparent; 1.0 is fully opaque.

      • getRGBA

        int getRGBA()
        Returns:
        a 32-bit integer packed with each of the color's components, one per byte. The order, from most significant to least, is red, green, blue, alpha.

      • getARGB

        int getARGB()
        Returns:
        a 32-bit integer packed with each of the color's components, one per byte. The order, from most significant to least, is alpha, red, green, blue.

      • glApply

        void glApply()
        Convenience method to update the OpenGL state to use this color.

        Equivalent to GL11.glColor4d(c.getRed(), c.getGreen(), c.getBlue(), c.getAlpha())

      • glApply

        void glApply(double alphaScale)
        Convenience method to update the OpenGL state to use this color, with the alpha value scaled by a specified factor. The Color instance remains unchanged by the factor. The final alpha value passed to OpenGL is clamped to [0.0, 1.0].

        Equivalent to c.copy().scaleAlpha(alphaScale).glApply(), without the extra Color instance creation.

      • isAnimating

        boolean isAnimating()
        Returns:
        true if this color is being updated by an active animation.

      • equals

        boolean equals(java.lang.Object other)
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

      • hashCode

        int hashCode()
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object

      • toString

        java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
